Motion to End Debate moved by Councillor Denzil Minnan-Wong (Lost)

That in accordance with the provisions of Chapter 27, Council Procedures, City Council end the debate on Bills 542 and 543 and take the vote immediately.


Vote (End Debate)

Jun-13-2014 11:06 AM
Result: Lost Two-Thirds Required - End debate on Bills 542 and 543
Yes: 23 Paul Ainslie, Ana Bail�o, Michelle Berardinetti, Shelley Carroll, Raymond Cho, Gary Crawford, Janet Davis, Sarah Doucette, Paula Fletcher, Mary Fragedakis, Mark Grimes, Norman Kelly, Mike Layton, Chin Lee, Pam McConnell, Mary-Margaret McMahon, Joe Mihevc, Denzil Minnan-Wong, John Parker (Chair), Gord Perks, Jaye Robinson, Karen Stintz, Kristyn Wong-Tam 
No: 13 Maria Augimeri, Josh Colle, Vincent Crisanti, Glenn De Baeremaeker, Frank Di Giorgio, Doug Ford, Peter Leon, Gloria Lindsay Luby, Giorgio Mammoliti, Josh Matlow, Anthony Perruzza, David Shiner, Michael Thompson 
Absent: 8 Mike Del Grande, John Filion, Rob Ford, Peter Milczyn, Ron Moeser, Frances Nunziata, Cesar Palacio, James Pasternak 

Point of Order by Councillor Giorgio Mammoliti

Councillor Mammoliti, rising on a Point of Order, stated that he had concerns about the Bill process and had requested the City Clerk to advise Council on whether the bills can be debated or referred.


Ruling by Councillor Frances Nunziata
Speaker Nunziata accepted the Point of Order and ruled that the City Clerk would respond to Councillor Mammoliti's questions.

Point of Order by Councillor Giorgio Mammoliti

Councillor Mammoliti, rising on a Point of Order, stated that he needed clarification around the rules regarding bills.


Ruling by Deputy Speaker John Parker
Deputy Speaker Parker, accepted the Point of Order and advised Council that a motion to introduce and pass a bill, other than a confirmatory bill, is debatable and may be amended but only as to form and to ensure it correctly implements the decision that it is intended to implement. The debate on a motion to introduce and pass a bill may not reopen or consider the substance of the decision or part of the decision. If the bill does not reflect the will of Council than a Member may refer a bill to the appropriate Committee to report back to Council on the bill.

Point of Order by Councillor Pam McConnell

Councillor McConnell, rising on a Point of Order, stated that Councillor Mammoliti was trying to redebate the issue and must restrict himself, must be explicit and not wander into a discussion on the previous debate.


Point of Order by Councillor Giorgio Mammoliti

Councillor Mammoliti, rising on a Point of Order, stated that part of the debate is to ask questions and he is trying to clarify what is in the bill.


Ruling by Deputy Speaker John Parker
Deputy Speaker Parker accepted the Points of Order, and instructed Councillor Mammoliti to keep his questions succinct as to whether the bill accurately reflects Council's decision, does it implement it and not to get into the substance.

Point of Order by Councillor David Shiner

Councillor Shiner, rising on a Point of Order, stated that the Deputy Speaker had allowed Members to speak on the Item and then had allowed questions of Staff.  Councillor Shiner requested clarification on whether a motion should be moved to procedurally allow questions of staff.


Ruling by Deputy Speaker John Parker
Deputy Speaker Parker accepted the Point of Order, and acknowledged that he thought Councillor Mammoliti was going to speak on the item however, when Councillor Mammoliti began to ask questions, he allowed him to continue to do so. Deputy Speaker Parker ruled that they would continue with questions and if Members did not agree, they could challenge his ruling.

Councillor Carroll challenged the Deputy Speaker's ruling but subsequently withdrew her challenge.

Point of Order by Councillor Gord Perks
Councillor Perks, rising on a Point of Order, stated that Councillor Mammoliti's comments on the Bills are out of order as there is no reference or comparison of the Council decision and the wording of the bill.  Councillor Perks further stated that the Deputy Speaker has asked Councillor Mammoliti several times to narrow his remarks on the bill as to form and whether it correctly implements the decision of Council and requested the Deputy Speaker to declare his speech over.

Ruling by Deputy Speaker John Parker
Deputy Speaker Parker, accepted the Point of Order and ruled that he would allow Councillor Mammoliti one more opportunity to keep his remarks on the bill as to form and whether it correctly implements the decision of Council.
Rulings (City Council)
Ruling by Deputy Speaker John Parker
Deputy Speaker Parker ruled that Councillor Mammoliti's questions regarding potential litigation are not before Council.
Declared Interests (City Council)

The following member(s) declared an interest:

Councillor Frances Nunziata - with respect to Bills 542 and 542 as her brother is an agent for the taxi industry.


Procedural Motions
Motion to Resolve to Committee of Whole moved by Councillor Gloria Lindsay Luby (Carried)

June 10, 2014 at 6:09 p.m. - That Council recess its public session to meet as Committee of the Whole in closed session to consider:

 

CC52.6            Appointment of a Toronto Integrity Commissioner (Ward All)

Reason for Confidential Information - Personal matters about an identifiable person and labour relations or employee negotiations

 

CC52.7            Appointment of a Toronto Auditor General (Ward All)

Reason for Confidential Information - Personal matters about an identifiable person and labour relations or employee negotiations

 

AU15.3           Review of the Redevelopment of the Sony Centre for the Performing Arts (Ward All)

Reason for Confidential Information – The security of property belonging to the City or one of its agencies and corporations, and personal matters about an identifiable person

 

EX42.12          Lakeshore Arena Corporation - Annual General Meeting and Audited Annual Financial Statements 2013 (Ward All)

Reason for Confidential Information – Personal matters about an identifiable individual, including municipal or local board employees

 

LS28.3            Feasibility of Licensing Wildlife Control Operators (Ward All)

Reason for Confidential Information – The receiving of advice that is subject to solicitor-client privilege

 

CC52.4            Toronto Street Furniture Program - Agreement Modifications Update (Ward All)

Reason for Confidential Information - The security of the property belonging to the City or one of its agencies, boards and commissions (pending)

 

CC52.5            Appointment of the Toronto Ombudsman (Ward All)

Reason for Confidential Information - Personal matters about an identifiable person and labour relations or employee negotiations


Vote (Resolve to Committee of Whole)

Jun-10-2014 6:09 PM
Result: Carried Majority Required - Meet in closed session
Yes: 32 Paul Ainslie, Maria Augimeri, Ana Bail�o, Michelle Berardinetti, Shelley Carroll, Josh Colle, Gary Crawford, Vincent Crisanti, Janet Davis, Glenn De Baeremaeker, Mike Del Grande, Frank Di Giorgio, Sarah Doucette, Paula Fletcher, Mark Grimes, Norman Kelly, Mike Layton, Chin Lee, Peter Leon, Gloria Lindsay Luby, Josh Matlow, Pam McConnell, Mary-Margaret McMahon, Denzil Minnan-Wong, Ron Moeser, Frances Nunziata (Chair), Cesar Palacio, Gord Perks, Anthony Perruzza, Jaye Robinson, David Shiner, Michael Thompson 
No: 0  
Absent: 12 Raymond Cho, John Filion, Doug Ford, Rob Ford, Mary Fragedakis, Giorgio Mammoliti, Joe Mihevc, Peter Milczyn, John Parker, James Pasternak, Karen Stintz, Kristyn Wong-Tam 

Report of Committee of the Whole

June 10, 2014 at 7:55 p.m. – Speaker Nunziata advised that City Council had completed its closed session consideration of the following Items:

 

•           CC52.6 - Appointment of a Toronto Integrity Commissioner

 

•           CC52.7 - Appointment of a Toronto Auditor General

 

City Council started, but had not completed its consideration of the following item:

 

•           AU15.3 - Review of the Redevelopment of the Sony Centre for the Performing Arts

 

City Council did not consider the following items during the closed session:

 

•           EX42.12 - Lakeshore Arena Corporation - Annual General Meeting and Audited Annual Financial Statements 2013

 

•           LS28.3 - Feasibility of Licensing Wildlife Control Operators

 

•           CC52.4 - Toronto Street Furniture Program - Agreement Modifications Update

 

•           CC52.5 - Appointment of the Toronto Ombudsman

Jun-11-2014 7:46 PM

Point of Privilege by Councillor Denzil Minnan-Wong

Councillor Minnan-Wong, rising on a Point of Privilege, stated that it is disrespectful for Members of Council to heckle or bother other Members who are holding Items.  Councillor Minnan-Wong requested that Members offer him the same respect as he provides to them.


Motion to Excuse Absentees moved by Deputy Mayor Norman Kelly (Carried)

June 13, 2014 at 4:07 p.m. - That City Council excuse the absence of Mayor Rob Ford from the June 10, 11, 12 and 13, 2014 City Council meeting.


Vote (Excuse Absentees)

Jun-13-2014 4:07 PM
Result: Carried Majority Required - Excuse Absence of Mayor Rob Ford
Yes: 29 Paul Ainslie, Maria Augimeri, Ana Bail�o, Shelley Carroll, Vincent Crisanti, Janet Davis, Glenn De Baeremaeker, Frank Di Giorgio, Sarah Doucette, Paula Fletcher, Doug Ford, Mary Fragedakis, Norman Kelly, Mike Layton, Chin Lee, Peter Leon, Gloria Lindsay Luby, Josh Matlow, Pam McConnell, Peter Milczyn, Denzil Minnan-Wong, Frances Nunziata (Chair), Cesar Palacio, John Parker, Gord Perks, Anthony Perruzza, David Shiner, Karen Stintz, Kristyn Wong-Tam 
No: 0  
Absent: 15 Michelle Berardinetti, Raymond Cho, Josh Colle, Gary Crawford, Mike Del Grande, John Filion, Rob Ford, Mark Grimes, Giorgio Mammoliti, Mary-Margaret McMahon, Joe Mihevc, Ron Moeser, James Pasternak, Jaye Robinson, Michael Thompson 

Council adjourned on June 13, 2014 at 5:24 p.m.

 

 

 

 

FRANCES NUNZIATA,                                ULLI S. WATKISS,

Speaker                                                           City Clerk
